detailed_info.name: Hydrolyzed keratin
detailed_info.description:
Keratin is a fibrous protein found in hair, feathers, wool and nails. This protein used in cosmetics is of animal origin and comes mostly from sheep wool (New Zealand is one of the largest producers). The plant version of keratin is called Phytokeratin and is better known in the INCI list under the term: "HYDROLYZED WHEAT PROTEIN".

In cosmetics, keratin is used to smooth and moisturize the cuticle of damaged hair. It fills cracks and eliminates frizz related to drying.

functions.name: Antistatic
functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Film forming
functions.description: Produces a continuous film on skin, hair or nails

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine

functions.name: Humectant
functions.description: Maintains water content of a cosmetic both in its packaging and on the skin

functions.description: Maintains skin in good condition
